results.title: Flutter and its prevention
results.brief_description: The significance of “flutter” in aerodynamics and its drastic results, ie aeroplane crash. Ways to prevent flutter and therefore avoid aircraft accidents and loss of life and valuable property.

results.title: Flute, clarinet and bassoon
results.brief_description: Introduces three of the woodwind instruments and illustrates the principle by which each produces a musical sound. How a scale is produced by the opening and closing of holes is demonstrated through diagrams and close-ups of each instrument. The instruments are played separately, in pairs and as a trio.

results.title: Fluoridation
results.brief_description: Informational film made up almost entirely by static animated stills from the US Public Health Service as a plea for all communities to incorporate fluoride into water systems for the sake of the health of our teeth. Briefly explains why fluoride is so condusive to dental health.

results.title: Fluid
results.brief_description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!

results.title: Flowers in daily life
results.brief_description: Introduces the traditional Japanese art of flower arrangement including its historical and spiritual aspects. Shows the viewer a step-by-step guide to the daily art of flower arrangement.

results.title: Flowers by request
results.creator_credit: Jules Taylor, AFTRS and Susan Wallace
results.brief_description: Two women who live quiet, eccentric lives have to come to terms with the possibility of separation when one of them has a stroke. At the point when Martha’s only option is being placed in aged care, Nancy steps in to bolster her friend’s spirits. This is a sensitive portrayal of two older women’s friendship and their struggle to retain this special relationship amid a daughter’s intention to place Martha in care. Cast includes Melissa Jaffer, Betty Lucas and Judy Morris.

results.title: Flowers at work
results.brief_description: Animation and time lapse cinematography show the physiology of flowers, various types of flowers, and their methods of pollination. The part played by insects in the process of cross-fertilisation is illustrated, and the structure and function of the sepals, petals, stamens, pistil, anthers, pollen grains, stle, and ovaries are studied. The film also shows some examples of how cultivation has modified the form of some flowers.

results.title: Flowers and the wide sea. Pt. 1: The Sojourners
results.creator_credit: Sharon Connolly, Tony Stevens and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Eric Rolls, this is the story of one of Australia’s oldest immigrant communities. The Chinese came to Australia as shepherds in the 19th century, driven from their villages by famine, was and poverty. In the 1850s thousands more arrived to seek their fortunes on the goldfields. After the goldrush some stayed in Australia to establish businesses and market gardens. By the 1870s the Chinese were growing almost three quarters of the country’s vegetable supply. In spite of the Chinese contribution to the emerging nation, anti-Chinese feeling ran high in Australia’s predominantly European community. Race riots subsided with the goldrush, but politicians and trade unionists waged campaigns aimed at blicking further Chinese immigration. After Australia’s federation in 1901, the first Act of the new Australian Parliament (the white Australia Policy) prevented the entry of more Chinese.
